snippet: One writer’s personal tale of two cities.
abstract: Thomas Beller describes experience of living two different lifestyles, maintaining homes in New Orleans, where he teaches at Tulane University, and New York City, where he spends winters and summers. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: ''Are you still here?'' It was early January in New York, the first week of my daughter's pre-kindergarten. Waiting for the elevator in the disorienting silence of post-drop off, I found myself staring at a gargoyle on the side of the Riverside Church, where she goes to school. ''Are you still here?'' she said again.
